clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase III Study of Remimazolam in Patients Undergoing Bronchoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III Study Evaluating the Efficacy and Safety of Remimazolam (CNS 7056) Compared to Placebo and Midazolam in Patients Undergoing Bronchoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective, double-blind, randomized, placebo and active controlled, multi-center, parallel group study comparing remimazolam to placebo, with an additional open label arm for midazolam, in patients undergoing a bronchoscopy.

study_design_info.masking: Double Blind (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to removal of bronchoscope
primary_outcome.description: Measured by completion of bronchoscopy, no requirement for an alternative sedative and no requirement for more than 5 top-ups of study medication within any 15 minute period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug until insertion of the bronchoscope, on Day 1.
From first dose of study drug until the lowest level of sedation, which has occurred during the bronchoscopy procedure, on Day 1
From the end of the bronchoscopy and after the last dose of study drug, until discharge, expected to be the same day.
From the last dose of study drug, until the patient has recovered to fully alert. Expected to be the same day.
secondary_outcome.description: Sedation will be measured using the MOAA/S scale every 30 seconds for the first 3 minutes and every minute thereafter until fully alert. Fully alert is defined as 3 consecutive MOAA/S scores of 5.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug until Day 4, or resolution of any ongoing adverse events.

arm_group.description: Remimazolam iv 5 mg for sedation induction, and 2.5 mg top-ups for sedation maintenance.
Placebo iv for sedation induction and maintenance.
Midazolam iv 1.75 mg* for sedation induction and 1.0 mg* for sedation maintenance. *1.0 mg for induction and 0.5 mg for maintenance in adults over 60, debilitated or chronically ill.

intervention.description: For induction and maintenance of sedation
For induction and maintenance of sedation
For induction and maintenance of sedation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients scheduled to undergo a diagnostic or therapeutic fiberoptic bronchoscopy in the bronchoscopy suite (e.g. lavage, biopsies, brushings, foreign body extraction)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Bronchoscopy outside the bronchoscopy suite (e.g. Intensive Care Unit)
- SpO2 < 90% in ambient air, or patients on chronic continuous O2 support or on mechanical ventilation
- Forced expiratory volume (FEV1) < 1L
- Tracheal stenosis
- Planned laser bronchoscopy, rigid scope bronchoscopy
